titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Raymond Rogers Gregory (1883-1967) graduated from Yale Divinity School in 1907. He was a missionary in Mexico from 1911 to 1918 and served with the Army and Navy YMCA during World War I. Gregory was the Foreign Agency Secretary for the American Bible Society from 1920 to 1952, posted in Panama and covering Central American Republics, Columbia, and Venezuela. He retired in 1952.

scopecontent.p: This collection is of approximately 70 undated glass lantern slides in both black and white and color. Locations include Guadalajara, Mexico City and Chihuahua. The images are of shops, people, landscapes, and buildings.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gregory, Mr. and Mrs. Thomas
